task.name: hsd_imaging
task.description:
The hsd_imaging task generates single dish images per antenna as well as combined image over whole antennas for each field and spectral window. Image configuration (grid size, number of pixels, etc.) is automatically determined based on meta data such as antenna diameter, map extent, etc.
Note that generated images are always in LSRK frame.
Output: results -- If pipeline mode is 'getinputs' then None is returned. Otherwise the results object for the pipeline task is returned.

param.name: mode
param.description: imaging mode controls imaging parameters in the task. Accepts either "line" (spectral line imaging) or "ampcal" (image settings for amplitude calibrator)

param.name: pipelinemode
param.description: The pipeline operating mode. In 'automatic' mode the pipeline determines the values of all context defined pipeline inputs automatically. In 'interactive' mode the user can set the pipeline context defined parameters manually. In 'getinputs' mode the user can check the settings of all pipeline parameters without running the task.

param.name: infiles
param.description: List of data files. These must be a name of MeasurementSets that are registered to context via hsd_importdata task. example: vis=['uid___A002_X85c183_X36f.ms', 'uid___A002_X85c183_X60b.ms']

param.name: field
param.shortdescription: Field to be imaged, e.g., "M100,Sgr*" (default all)
param.description: Data selection by field names or ids. example: "*Sgr*,M100"

param.name: spw
param.shortdescription: select data by spectral window IDs, e.g. "3,5,7" (default all)
param.description: Data selection by spw ids. example: "3,4" (generate images for spw 3 and 4)

param.name: dryrun
param.shortdescription: Run the task (False) or display task command (True)
param.description: Run the commands (True) or generate the commands to be run but do not execute (False).

param.name: acceptresults
param.shortdescription: Add the results into the pipeline context
param.description: Add the results of the task to the pipeline context (True) or reject them (False).
